entry.title: Multiple Quantum Well
entry.content:
Multiple Quantum Well

A quantum well is a potential well with only discrete energy values.


This Figure shows a typical structure of multiple quantum well (MQW). Compared with traditional active layer, MQW has step-like electronic density of states which is easy to obtain narrow linewidth lasing. Compared with single quantum well, the active layer enhances its optical confinement factor and ability to collect unbalanced carriers. The TE mode in MQW, it is should be noted, has larger gain than TM mode due to more heavy holes than light holes (1 ).
Due to quantum effect, in simplified model, the optical absorption in a quantum well is a series of steps. And as showed in figure below, it is the same rule as that in electron density. Further more, in the quantum wire is a series of peaks, and in the quantum dot in a series of line.

Optical Confinement Factor

Because the effective length of fundamental mode light field is much greater than thickness of MQW layer, the ΓM\Gamma_MΓM​ in quantum well can be consider as:

ΓW≈ΓMQWNWdWNWdW+NBdB\Gamma_W \approx \Gamma_{MQW} \frac{N_W d_W}{N_W d_W + N_B d_B} ΓW​≈ΓMQW​NW​dW​+NB​dB​NW​dW​​

ΓMQW=2π2(NWdW+NBdB)2n2−ne2λ\Gamma_{MQW} = 2\pi^2 \left(N_Wd_W + N_Bd_B\right)^2 \frac{n^2 - n_e^2}{\lambda} ΓMQW​=2π2(NW​dW​+NB​dB​)2λn2−ne2​​

n=NWdwnw+NBdbnBNWdW+NBdBn = \frac{N_W d_w n_w + N_B d_b n_B}{N_W d_W + N_B d_B} n=NW​dW​+NB​dB​NW​dw​nw​+NB​db​nB​​

Where NWN_WNW​ and NBN_BNB​ are number of quantum well and its barrier, dWd_WdW​ and dBd_BdB​ are thickness of them, nnn is average refractive index of MQW layer, nen_ene​ is effective refractive index.

entry.title: Principle of Laser Devices
entry.content:
Introduction of Laser


This figure shows principle of a conventional quantum laser where the electrons are bound to atomic, molecular or solid-state energy levels (”bound-electron laser”). Here, laser (active/gain) medium is pumped (by light or electron) and produces spontaneous emission and finally meet “gain” condition (threshold).
The semiconductor laser is similar to this.

Threshold condition

To generate laser, it is important to give enough pump power and we can evaluate pump intensity by gain:

g=ηiλ2J8πen2dΔvg = \frac{\eta_{i} \lambda^2 J}{8 \pi e n^2 d \Delta v} g=8πen2dΔvηi​λ2J​

Where ηi\eta_{i}ηi​ is internal quantum efficiency, λ\lambdaλ is wavelength, JJJ is current density, eee is electron charge, nnn is refractive index of gain medium, Δv\Delta vΔv is spontaneous emission linewidth (in frequency).
Part of the photons will diffuse to the non-active regions at both ends of the junction, and the lateral spatial distribution of light intensity (photon density) is shown in the figure below:


Compared to gain, loss (α\alphaα) describes the optical loss of the cavity. In general, α\alphaα can be divided into many parts:

α=αi+αrad+αo\alpha = \alpha_{i} + \alpha_{rad} + \alpha_{o} α=αi​+αrad​+αo​

Where αi\alpha_{i}αi​ is internal loss ( mainly due to free carrier absorption of the waveguide material and to scattering loss caused by the roughness of the waveguide wall), αrad\alpha_{rad}αrad​ is the radiation loss, αo\alpha_{o}αo​ is other loss (in normal negligible).
Once g>αg \gt \alphag>α, pump intensity is enough to laser. Especially, in photonic-crystal surface-emitting lasers (PCSELs), αrad\alpha_{rad}αrad​ can be expressed by quality factor (QQQ):

α=2π/aQ\alpha = \frac{2\pi / a}{Q} α=Q2π/a​

Where aaa is period of photonic crystal. And physic define of QQQ is:

Q=2πνEP=2πντR=λΔλQ = 2\pi \nu \frac{E}{P} = 2\pi \nu \tau_R = \frac{\lambda}{\Delta\lambda} Q=2πνPE​=2πντR​=Δλλ​

Where EEE is energy in cavity, PPP is power loss of cavity, τR\tau_RτR​ is called as resonator life, Δλ\Delta\lambdaΔλ is also linewidth (but in wavelength).
Note that only d/Dd/Dd/D (Γ\GammaΓ, Optical confinement factor) part of the photons are in the active region and generate new photons by stimulated emission. This effect reduces the effective gain of the device. Thus, the threshold condition is:

gΓ=αg\Gamma = \alpha gΓ=α

Jth=8πen2Δvd/Γηiλ2(αi+αcavity)J_{th} = \frac{8 \pi e n^2 \Delta v d /\Gamma}{\eta_{i} \lambda^2} \left( \alpha_i + \alpha_{cavity} \right) Jth​=ηi​λ28πen2Δvd/Γ​(αi​+αcavity​)

In Watt-class high-power, high-beam-quality photonic-crystal lasers | Nature Photonics by S. Noda, the λ\lambdaλ is 0.94 μm\mu mμm, ηi\eta_iηi​ is 0.9 and αi\alpha_iαi​ is 5 cm−1cm^{-1}cm−1.

Output Power

Obviously, power loss of cavity EEE can be considered as output power to a certain extent. And all losses are in α\alphaα. Under threshold condition, internal power efficiency is:

η=αradα\eta = \frac{\alpha_{rad}}{\alpha} η=ααrad​​

Output power is:

Pout=ηPin=η[JeηiShν]P_{out} = \eta P_{in} = \eta \left[\frac{J}{e} \eta_{i}Sh\nu \right] Pout​=ηPin​=η[eJ​ηi​Shν]

Where SSS is area of pump, JJJ is more than the threshold current density JthJ_{th}Jth​.
Thus, device output power efficiency is:

ηout=PoutPin+(JS)2Rs\eta_{out} = \frac{P_{out}}{P_{in}+\left(JS\right)^2 R_s} ηout​=Pin​+(JS)2Rs​Pout​​

Where RsR_sRs​ is diode series resistance.

entry.title: RDP Wrapper
entry.content:
What is RDP Wrapper

Remote Desktop is a convenient tool on Windows. However, if you want to remote link to an other Computer with Home Edition, it is difficult to do so because Microsoft has disabled this feature in this edition (but not delete).

RDP Wrapper works as a layer between Service Control Manager and Terminal Services, so the original termsrv.dll file remains untouched. Also this method is very strong against Windows Update.

Rdpwarp is a out-of-the-box software to enable Remote Desktop Host on Home Edition.

What You Need To

  1. Download RDP Wrapper, and run install.bat.
  2. Update you C:\Program Files\RDP Wrapper\rdpwrap.ini, learn more . The latest rdpwrap.ini can be found on GitHub, and here is one.
  3. Run RDPConf.exe to check whether all are passed.
  4. All done.
